file_content.text: Nar Shaddaa's crawling with criminals, but they have their uses.
The mercenaries now know that a Republic friendship is a death sentence.
I knew you'd convince them! From now on, the fools will think twice before leaving Imperial employ.
I suppose the mercs won't need their pay for the moment. Take it, for your troubles.
The mercs were fools to abandon us.
What a relief, my lord! You wouldn't believe the criminal filth I've had to put up with.
Sir, good to see you. Imperials should stick together out here.
Pleasure, hunter. At least one soldier of fortune is decent enough to stay loyal.
Finally, civilized company. These gangsters are scum, every last one!
My hired mercenaries just abandoned me. "Republic made a better offer," they said. If I'd had my blaster... well it wouldn't have been pretty.
No one turns their back on the Empire.
They'll regret their betrayal.
Yes, my lord. But they aren't the first cretins to run off.
Mercenaries respond to more than credits. If they feared you, they'd still be here.
Their walkout is your failure.
Due respect, my lord, but this slime's emboldened by their traitorous friends.
The Empire needs to make a counteroffer. The mercs serve us, and we let them live.
We must bring them in line.
Exactly what I was thinking, sir. Only, these thugs of mine aren't the first to run.
Sounds like a business decision. Outbid the Republic, and your mercs will come back.
Don't make it personal.
Even if you ignored the insult, you can't barter with these fools. They're not even the first to run off.
Thugs make poor allies.
I know, I know. But on Nar Shaddaa, you're only as good as your underworld connections.
You against mercs? Yeah right.
You'd have missed every shot.
Point taken. But I'm not about to argue with you while those... those thugs are cavorting with the enemy.
We're hemorrhaging more mercs every day to the Republic. Nova Guard, Crimson Brotherhood... this keeps up, we'll lose our foothold, our entire slave trade.
The mercenaries need to realize the consequences of a Republic partnership. We need to send them a message, written in blood.
The mercs will learn or die.
I'll need compensation.
Oh, you'll be paid. But don't promise any of those other mercs the same.
I can get behind that.
If you're after a fight, the mercs won't disappoint.
Take out their ringleaders, then destroy the supplies the Republic used to buy their loyalty.
And please scrape your boots clean when you're done stomping out the mercenaries. I can't stand their stench.
You kill them. [Refuse quest]
Maybe I will.
What's this moon coming to?
